title: update (most) deps
body: All but k8s_openapi which will be more work

title: don't panic if expires-on is missing in odd azure-auth-provider case
body: see title

title: Allow specifiying which kubectl binary to use as a config value
body:
- adds the config option
- adds `[set/unset] kubectl_binary [value]` commands

title: Parse ca certs one by one, since mac reqwest doesn't seem to handle multiple in one string
body: This will fix https://github.com/databricks/click/issues/195. Reqwest on osx seems to not support parsing multiple certs in one string, so we split them up and add them one at a time.

title: initial migration to abstracted colors using crossterm
body: This redirects all text style choices to a `Styles` module, setting the stage for turning off color and adding themes

title: describe command uses a table for output
body: We have a nice table formatting library, let's use it to output describe

title: Actually do Dynamic tables
body: Previous PR didn't include this due to a silly git stash. Actually do dynamic table content to make table formatting nice

title: use Dyanmic content for tables
body: This makes tables with long lines print much more nicely

title: switch to is_valid_arg
body: we were using the wrong check, so --labels and --show didn't work

title: migrate to comfy-table
body:
prettytable isn't maintained anymore https://github.com/phsym/prettytable-rs/issues/139. this migrates to comfy-table which is pretty similar (but better).

also allows removing the old term crate

title: Describe cleanup and enhancement
body:
Clean up some of the describe code. 

* Add a way to describe just based on metadata, so it works for all objects
* Move describe into its own module since it's somewhat complex
* make generic describe method match args of the custom ones so we can use a macro for both

This sets things up for more detailed describe information for particular objects.

title: prevent panic on commands without a show arg
check if "labels" is a valid arg first
body: prevents panics

title: Overhaul auth-provider support, add (some) azure and oidc support
body: No support for token refresh for those providers yet

title: update edition to 2021 and handle lints
body: Update the edition to 2021 and deal with all the IntoIter deprecation warnings

title: add copy command
body: Add a copy command to copy files to/from a pod

title: Forward parent environment variables in kube config exec commands
body:
The kube config exec commands did not forward parent environment variables, causing the `aws` or `aws-iam-authenticator` to not run properly (due to lack of `$PATH`).

With this, it should match `kubectl` behavior and should fully close https://github.com/databricks/click/issues/89

title: need arg names to line up
body: Now that it's all unified, everything needs to use the `labels` arg name

title: changes for clap 2x -> 3x
body: Clap 3.x has a pretty different api, so lots of changes needed. Not a lot of logic changes fortunately.

title: Don't unwrap on ca_cert and endpoint parsing, plus tests
get timestamps in coherent way for events
body: Get timestamps for events in the same way for comparison and printing

title: sort properly, add CellSpecText::None
body: Switch to tracking a None type cellspec, and sort it properly. Have it print "Unknown/None" since it can be either.

title: add a last restart column for pods
body: Show the last time a pod container restarted (if it has)

title: fix rustyline crash
body: Fixes issue caused by https://github.com/kkawakam/rustyline/issues/575

title: use a new client for logs
body: single request timeout setting is all broken in reqwest (https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/1380), so just use a whole new client with a max timeout for `logs -f` until it's fixed

title: Make CellSpecTxt hold different types
body: This allows us to keep things in a sortable form until just before printing, so there's no need for odd Pre/Post sort stuff as before.

title: add an int type for cellspec and use for sorting int cols
Add crd command
body: This adds a `crd` command that can get info about resources defined in crds.

title: Make requests return ClickErrors, and env return Result not Option
body:
This allows better error handling at higher levels. For this particular PR the main noticable
difference is that the `logs` command will print a more reasonable error if the api-server returns a
failure.

title: Switch to k8s openapi
body: This is a giant update where we migrate away from the old manual way of connecting, and also away from using out of date hyper clients with weird hacks. this just uses reqwest as the http client and k8s_openapi.

title: Add support for argo rollouts
body:
This adds support for argo rollouts.

Here's proof it works:
[aws-us-west-2] [development] [none] > rollouts
 ####  Name              Desired  Current  Up To Date  Available  Age
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
    0  service             2        2         2           2      4h 58m
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
[aws-us-west-2] [development] [none] > 0
[aws-us-west-2] [development] [service] > describe
Name:		service
Namespace:	development
Created at:	2021-09-28 13:55:10 UTC (2021-09-28 06:55:10 -07:00)
Generation:	2
Labels:		app=service
Desired Replicas:	2
Current Replicas:	2
Up To Date Replicas:	2
Available Replicas:	2

Containers:
  Name: service
    Image:	myimage

Messages:
  Message: RolloutCompleted
  Message: ReplicaSet "service-84fb8ff6" has successfully progressed.
  Message: Rollout has minimum availability

title: actually use objs so that new lists don't mess up the selection
body: With just an index, if a new command is run the list is replaced and the index doesn't make sense anymore.

title: Make last list just hold KObjs
body: Also needs to add some cleanup for range parsing

title: allow exec to properly handle -- to exec complex comands
Allow tab completions for specific options
body: This allows specifying completions for named options. It also adds completers for the various --sort args, and for the --container arg to exec

title: switch to github actions
body: migrate to github actions

title: sort events by time
body:
- sort events by time
- `cargo update`

title: Tab-complete Kubernetes context in alphabetical order.
body:
The `HashMap` order is arbitrary, but it's kind of nice to have tab-completion proceed in alphabetical order.

![render1598295464052](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63264495/91085141-fc9e6a80-e61a-11ea-89a8-c4006cde8a22.gif)

title: Force hyper-sync-rustls below version 0.3.0-rc.17
body:
Recent upgrade in `hyper-sync-rustls` upgraded their `rustls` to `0.17.0` and conflicted with our dependency of `0.16.0`. This PR forces a ceiling on our `hyper-sync-rustls` version.

Fixes #147

title: Add describe for deployment
body:
Rudimentary `describe` for deployments. (and also added `DescItem::Valu64` in the process)

```
[dev] [default] [2 Deployments selected] > describe
--- alertmanager ---
Name:           alertmanager
Namespace:      default
Created at:     2016-09-24 04:23:54 UTC (2016-09-23 23:23:54 -05:00)
Generation:     47
Labels:         app=alertmanager
Desired Replicas:       1
Current Replicas:       1
Up To Date Replicas:    1
Available Replicas:     1

Containers:
  Name: prometheus-config-watcher
    Image:      registry.dev.databricks.com/universe/prometheus-config-watcher:0.6
  Name: alertmanager
    Image:      prom/alertmanager:v0.19.0

Messages:
  Message: Deployment has minimum availability.


--- metrics-search ---
Name:           metrics-search
Namespace:      default
Created at:     2018-09-14 22:07:15 UTC (2018-09-14 17:07:15 -05:00)
Generation:     4
Labels:         app=metrics-search
                project=metrics-search
Desired Replicas:       1
Current Replicas:       1
Up To Date Replicas:    1
Available Replicas:     1

Containers:
  Name: metrics-search
    Image:      registry.dev.databricks.com/universe/metrics-search:latest
  Name: auth-proxy
    Image:      registry.dev.databricks.com/oauth2_proxy:7eb7e0b95666b4c026270d4a8723c1aeb0309410-20170625-231803

Messages:
  Message: Deployment has minimum availability.

```

title: event counts can be null too
Fix events with null timestamp
body: Handle the case the `last_timestamp` is null

title: Fix issues #140 and #141
body: Also switches to new exec format with `--`

title: fix delete issue
body: Small fix for a bug in delete

title: Retry on reset connections
body:
Many people have reported getting connection resets of the form:

`Hyper error: Connection reset by peer (os error 54)`

or

`Hyper error: Connection reset by peer (os error 104) (None)`

This catches that error and retries (once), which seems to fix it. Should have a deeper followup to figure out why this happens.

title: update some deps, add env_logger
body: Update some deps, and add env_logger to help debug in dependent libs

title: increase logs request timeout
body: one second is too short to wait for logs

title: handle -f and ctrl-c properly for logs
body: move reading to a separate thread, send over channel

title: Add connect timeout, make read/connect timeouts configurable
body: Adds new config options `read_timeout_secs` and `connect_timeout_secs` to allow configuring how long click should wait to read/write data, and how long to timeout after when trying to connect to a host.

title: Add support for exec style auth
body:
Allow auth via exec:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/authentication/#input-and-output-formats

title: Add support for ranges (and other fixes)
body:
Primarily this adds support for selecting and operating on ranges of objects.

Lots of other cleanups too:
- use clickwriteln instead of embeded newlines
- add lots of new unit tests
- add a concept of `kobj` which will help encapsulate behavior of selected objects better
- many little bug fixes

title: Big cleanup of main.rs plus --exec
body:
This has a pretty big changeset:
- Create a `CommandProcessor` which handles all the processing of input, moved all that code from main.rs into command_processor.rs
- Move `Env` into its own file, env.rs
- Add completion to help
- Add unit tests for command_processor and env
- Make the completer not need unsafe anymore
- Support a `--exec` arg to exec a command
- Other small fixes + improvements

title: Make travis run fmt and clippy
body: Adds rules to .travis.yaml to run tests for cargo fmt and cargo clippy

title: Start unit testing
body: Add unit tests for config/click.rs and config/kubefile.rs

title: Code cleanup
body: big `cargo fmt` plus making clippy happy

title: *sigh* come on duct!
body: update duct to 0.13

title: Fixes for 0.4.2
body: Need to update rustyline version and fix an issue

title: Fix webpki errors for  IP SAN certs
body:
This PR uses a hack to support certs with IpAddress SANs.  This is what minikube uses, so it's important for click to support them.

This is pretty gross, but works.  We can remove this when webpki supports IpAddress SANs properly.

title: Update duct to 0.12, which is what duct_sh depends on
Make install instructions slightly more explicit
Config overhaul
body:
This moves all the config stuff into its own directory, and also makes it more sane.

Also adds separates out client cert/key and other auth methods, allowing both to be specified.

title: Changelog and 0.4.0
body: Adds things for the 0.4.0 release

title: Sort all the things
body:
This adds sorting to Nodes, Services, and Deployments.

That's not really "all the things", but enough of the things that might return a lot of stuff that it's merge-able like this.

Will wait for bigger command-abstraction re-write to really sort everything

title: Add -y/--yaml for describe to output yaml
Rustyline 3.0
body:
This updates to the newest version of RustyLine.

This includes a number of things:
- Overhaul of the completion logic for the new api
- Adding completion for options for all commands
- ability to set the edit_mode and completion type and using those settings

title: Make config write atomic, and write it more often
body:
It sucks to loose your aliases because click was killed for some reason.  This PR makes it so that any time you add/remove and alias, or change context, the config file is written out.

It also makes it so writing the config is atomic (using the `atomicfile` crate), so it's safe to do this from multiple running instances of Click.

title: Add node to pod display
body: This adds node as a possible column, and also allows passing an arg to sort pods by a certain field

title: Add alias command
body:
Adds `alias` and `unalias` commands that work similarly to bash.

This is been tested on old config files and should not cause any issues with them.

title: Use dirs crate
body: This is #80 with a tiny bit of cleanup

title: Hyper sync rustls
body: This is essentially #84, but with slightly less specific versions, and rebased to master

title: bump version of yaml-rust and serde_yaml
body:
While looking at #66 I found out there are now 3 crates marked as vulnerable by `cargo-audit` in click. These are `untrusted`, `serde_yaml` and `yaml-rust` (dependency of `serde_yaml`).

This PR updates `serde_yaml` to the latest version.

`untrusted` is going to be a bit harder to update as it's a dependency of `hyper` and `hyper-rustls`.

title: add statefulset support
body:
Adding support for statefulsets.
Again this is mostly based on other similar parts (replicasets) of the program.

The patch compatibility goes back to v1.9 as v1.8 and earlier mark the API as beta.

title: Add job support
body:
Second attempt on getting the job support in.
Old PR for reference #68.

title: Add Instructions for Arch AUR Installation
Add support for multiple files in KUBECONFIG
body:
Hi there,

let me start by saying that you have a very nice project here.
I've been enjoying using it for couple of the last days, however the lack of support for multiple files in `KUBECONFIG` makes it pretty usable for me.

I've been playing around with it a bit and decided to hack together a simple support for multiple files (addressing #49).

What I'm doing here is that I'm processing all paths in `KUBECONFIG` into separate `config::Config` structs and then merging them into a single one that is then fed into the environment.
The source_file field is merged using OS specific path separators.
While merging of the other fields is done by simple map extending.

I've tested it with my workflow and it worked flawlessly, but I can image the change might break something I've not tested.
 
Let me know what you think, I'm open to any suggestions.
